docblock.description: Client to connect the the elasticsearch server

property.name: $_config
property.default: array('host' => null, 'port' => null, 'path' => null, 'url' => null, 'transport' => null, 'persistent' => true, 'timeout' => null, 'connections' => array(), 'roundRobin' => false, 'log' => false, 'retryOnConflict' => 0)

docblock.description: Uses _bulk to send documents to the server
docblock.long-description: Array of \Elastica\Document as input. Index and type has to be set inside the document, because for bulk settings documents, documents can belong to any type and index
Requires elasticsearch >= 0.19.0

tag.name: param
tag.description: array of query params to use for query. For possible options check es api

tag.name: param
tag.description: Array of field names to be populated or '_source' if whole document data should be updated

docblock.description: Returns the status object for all indices
Deletes documents with the given ids, index, type from the index

docblock.long-description:
Every entry in the params array has to exactly on array of the bulk operation. An example param array would be:

array( array('index' => array('_index' => 'test', '_type' => 'user', '_id' => '1')), array('user' => array('name' => 'hans')), array('delete' => array('_index' => 'test', '_type' => 'user', '_id' => '2')) );

docblock.description: Makes calls to the elasticsearch server based on this index
docblock.long-description: It's possible to make any REST query directly over this method

To use this feature you have to call the following command in the elasticsearch directory:

./bin/plugin -install elasticsearch/elasticsearch-mapper-attachments/1.6.0

This installs the tika file analysis plugin. More infos about supported formats can be found here: {@link http://tika.apache.org/0.7/formats.html}

docblock.long-description: All settings listed in the update settings API (http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/api/admin-indices-update-settings.html) can be changed on a running indices. To make changes like the merge policy (http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/index-modules/merge.html) the index has to be closed first and reopened after the call

docblock.description: Returns the current settings of the index
docblock.long-description: If param is set, only specified setting is return. 'index.' is added in front of $setting.

docblock.description: Sets the index to read only

docblock.long-description: Value can be for example 3s for 3 seconds or 5m for 5 minutes. -1 refreshing is disabled.
If no interval is set, the default interval is returned
To have this changes made the index has to be closed and reopened

docblock.description: Returns the specific merge policy value
Can be used to set/update settings
Updates the given settings for the index
docblock.long-description: With elasticsearch 0.16 the following settings are supported - index.term_index_interval - index.term_index_divisor - index.translog.flush_threshold_ops - index.translog.flush_threshold_size - index.translog.flush_threshold_period - index.refresh_interval - index.merge.policy - index.auto_expand_replicas

docblock.description: Allow wildcards (*, ?) as the first character in a query.
Enable best effort analysis of wildcard terms.
Set the analyzer name used to analyze the query string.

docblock.long-description:
A query that matches documents matching boolean combinations of other queries.

The bool query maps to Lucene BooleanQuery.

It is built using one or more boolean clauses, each clause with a typed occurrence.

The occurrence types are: must, should, must_not.
Alias of close() for ease of reading in source.

docblock.description: Sets the boost value of the query.

docblock.long-description:
A query that wraps a filter or another query and simply returns a constant score equal to the query boost for every document in the filter.

Maps to Lucene ConstantScoreQuery.
Alias of close() for ease of reading in source.

docblock.description: The default field for query terms if no prefix field is specified.
The default operator used if no explicit operator is specified.
docblock.long-description: For example, with a default operator of OR, the query "capital of Hungary" is translated to "capital OR of OR Hungary", and with default operator of AND, the same query is translated to "capital AND of AND Hungary".

A query that generates the union of documents produced by its subqueries, and that scores each document with the maximum score for that document as produced by any subquery, plus a tie breaking increment for any additional matching subqueries.
Alias of close() for ease of reading in source.

docblock.description: Enable position increments in result queries.
Enables explanation for each hit on how its score was computed.

docblock.long-description:
Facets provide aggregated data based on a search query.

In the simple case, a facet can return facet counts for various facet values for a specific field.

ElasticSearch supports more advanced facet implementations, such as statistical or date histogram facets.
Alias of close() for ease of reading in source.

docblock.description: Add a specific field / value entry.

docblock.long-description:
Alias of close() for ease of reading in source. Passed parameters will be ignored, however they can be useful in source for seeing which field is being closed.

Builder::factory() ->query() ->range() ->fieldOpen('created') ->gte('2011-07-18 00:00:00') ->lt('2011-07-19 00:00:00') ->fieldClose('created') ->rangeClose() ->queryClose();

docblock.description: The clause (query) must not appear in the matching documents.

docblock.long-description:
The $transport parameter can be one of the following values:

  • string: The short name of a transport. For instance "Http", "Memcache" or "Thrift"
  • object: An already instantiated instance of a transport
  • array: An array with a "type" key which must be set to one of the two options. All other keys in the array will be set as parameters in the transport instance

docblock.description: Abstract helper class to implement search indices based on models.
docblock.long-description:
This abstract model should help creating search index and a subtype with some easy config entries that are overloaded.

The following variables have to be set: - $_indexName - $_typeName

The following variables can be set for additional configuration - $_mapping: Value type mapping for the given type - $_indexParams: Parameters for the index
